verses.text_plain: And king Zedekiah the son of Josiah reigned instead of Coniah the son of Jehoiakim, whom Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon made king in the land of Judah.
verses.verse_html: 1And king Zedekiah the son of Josiah reigned instead of Coniah the son of Jehoiakim, whom Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon made king in the land of Judah.

verses.text_plain: But neither he, nor his servants, nor the people of the land, did hearken unto the words of the Lord, which he spake by the prophet Jeremiah.
verses.verse_html:
2But neither he, nor his servants, nor the people of the land, did hearken unto the words of the Lord, which he spake by the prophet Jeremiah. ▼
▼ by…: Heb. by the hand of the prophet

tokens.text: But neither he, nor his servants

footnotes.body_text: ▼ by…: Heb. by the hand of the prophet
footnotes.body_html: ▼ by…: Heb. by the hand of the prophet

verses.text_plain: And Zedekiah the king sent Jehucal the son of Shelemiah and Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah the priest to the prophet Jeremiah, saying, Pray now unto the Lord our God for us.
verses.verse_html: 3And Zedekiah the king sent Jehucal the son of Shelemiah and Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah the priest to the prophet Jeremiah, saying, Pray now unto the Lord our God for us.

verses.text_plain: Now Jeremiah came in and went out among the people: for they had not put him into prison.
verses.verse_html: 4Now Jeremiah came in and went out among the people: for they had not put him into prison.

verses.text_plain: Then Pharaoh’s army was come forth out of Egypt: and when the Chaldeans that besieged Jerusalem heard tidings of them, they departed from Jerusalem.
verses.verse_html: 5Then Pharaoh’s army was come forth out of Egypt: and when the Chaldeans that besieged Jerusalem heard tidings of them, they departed from Jerusalem.

verses.text_plain: Then came the word of the Lord unto the prophet Jeremiah, saying,
verses.verse_html: 6Then came the word of the Lord unto the prophet Jeremiah, saying,

verses.text_plain: Thus saith the Lord, the God of Israel; Thus shall ye say to the king of Judah, that sent you unto me to enquire of me; Behold, Pharaoh’s army, which is come forth to help you, shall return to Egypt into their own land.
verses.verse_html: 7Thus saith the Lord, the God of Israel; Thus shall ye say to the king of Judah, that sent you unto me to enquire of me; Behold, Pharaoh’s army, which is come forth to help you, shall return to Egypt into their own land.

verses.text_plain: And the Chaldeans shall come again, and fight against this city, and take it, and burn it with fire.
verses.verse_html: 8And the Chaldeans shall come again, and fight against this city, and take it, and burn it with fire.

verses.text_plain: Thus saith the Lord; Deceive not yourselves, saying, The Chaldeans shall surely depart from us: for they shall not depart.
verses.verse_html:
9Thus saith the Lord; Deceive not yourselves, saying, The Chaldeans shall surely depart from us: for they shall not depart. ▼
▼ yourselves: Heb. your souls

tokens.text: from us: for they shall not depart

footnotes.body_html: ▼ yourselves: Heb. your souls

verses.text_plain: For though ye had smitten the whole army of the Chaldeans that fight against you, and there remained but wounded men among them, yet should they rise up every man in his tent, and burn this city with fire.
verses.verse_html:
10For though ye had smitten the whole army of the Chaldeans that fight against you, and there remained but wounded men among them, yet should they rise up every man in his tent, and burn this city with fire. ▼
▼ wounded: Heb. thrust through

footnotes.body_html: ▼ wounded: Heb. thrust through

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass, that when the army of the Chaldeans was broken up from Jerusalem for fear of Pharaoh’s army,
verses.verse_html:
11And it came to pass, that when the army of the Chaldeans was broken up from Jerusalem for fear of Pharaoh’s army, ▼
▼ broken…: Heb. made to ascend

tokens.text: And it came to pass, that when the army

footnotes.body_html: ▼ broken…: Heb. made to ascend

verses.text_plain: Then Jeremiah went forth out of Jerusalem to go into the land of Benjamin, to separate himself thence in the midst of the people.
verses.verse_html:
12Then Jeremiah went forth out of Jerusalem to go into the land of Benjamin, to separate himself thence in the midst of the people. ▼
▼ separate…: or, to slip away from thence in the midst of the people

footnotes.body_text: ▼ separate…: or, to slip away from thence in the midst of the people
footnotes.body_html: ▼ separate…: or, to slip away from thence in the midst of the people

verses.text_plain: And when he was in the gate of Benjamin, a captain of the ward was there, whose name was Irijah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Hananiah; and he took Jeremiah the prophet, saying, Thou fallest away to the Chaldeans.
verses.verse_html: 13And when he was in the gate of Benjamin, a captain of the ward was there, whose name was Irijah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Hananiah; and he took Jeremiah the prophet, saying, Thou fallest away to the Chaldeans.

tokens.text: And when he was in the gate

verses.text_plain: Then said Jeremiah, It is false; I fall not away to the Chaldeans. But he hearkened not to him: so Irijah took Jeremiah, and brought him to the princes.
verses.verse_html:
14Then said Jeremiah, It is false; I fall not away to the Chaldeans. But he hearkened not to him: so Irijah took Jeremiah, and brought him to the princes. ▼
▼ false: Heb. falsehood, or, a lie

footnotes.body_text: ▼ false: Heb. falsehood, or, a lie
footnotes.body_html: ▼ false: Heb. falsehood, or, a lie

verses.text_plain: Wherefore the princes were wroth with Jeremiah, and smote him, and put him in prison in the house of Jonathan the scribe: for they had made that the prison.
verses.verse_html: 15Wherefore the princes were wroth with Jeremiah, and smote him, and put him in prison in the house of Jonathan the scribe: for they had made that the prison.

verses.text_plain: When Jeremiah was entered into the dungeon, and into the cabins, and Jeremiah had remained there many days;
verses.verse_html:
16When Jeremiah was entered into the dungeon, and into the cabins, and Jeremiah had remained there many days; ▼
▼ cabins: or, cells

verses.text_plain: Then Zedekiah the king sent, and took him out: and the king asked him secretly in his house, and said, Is there any word from the Lord? And Jeremiah said, There is: for, said he, thou shalt be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon.
verses.verse_html: 17Then Zedekiah the king sent, and took him out: and the king asked him secretly in his house, and said, Is there any word from the Lord? And Jeremiah said, There is: for, said he, thou shalt be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon.

verses.text_plain: Moreover Jeremiah said unto king Zedekiah, What have I offended against thee, or against thy servants, or against this people, that ye have put me in prison?
verses.verse_html: 18Moreover Jeremiah said unto king Zedekiah, What have I offended against thee, or against thy servants, or against this people, that ye have put me in prison?

tokens.text: against thee, or against thy servants

verses.text_plain: Where are now your prophets which prophesied unto you, saying, The king of Babylon shall not come against you, nor against this land?
verses.verse_html: 19Where are now your prophets which prophesied unto you, saying, The king of Babylon shall not come against you, nor against this land?

tokens.text: against you, nor against this land

verses.text_plain: Therefore hear now, I pray thee, O my lord the king: let my supplication, I pray thee, be accepted before thee; that thou cause me not to return to the house of Jonathan the scribe, lest I die there.
verses.verse_html:
20Therefore hear now, I pray thee, O my lord the king: let my supplication, I pray thee, be accepted before thee; that thou cause me not to return to the house of Jonathan the scribe, lest I die there. ▼
▼ let…: Heb. let my supplication fall

tokens.text: now, I pray thee, O my lord
thee; that thou cause me not to return

footnotes.body_text: ▼ let…: Heb. let my supplication fall
footnotes.body_html: ▼ let…: Heb. let my supplication fall

verses.text_plain: Then Zedekiah the king commanded that they should commit Jeremiah into the court of the prison, and that they should give him daily a piece of bread out of the bakers’ street, until all the bread in the city were spent. Thus Jeremiah remained in the court of the prison.
verses.verse_html: 21Then Zedekiah the king commanded that they should commit Jeremiah into the court of the prison, and that they should give him daily a piece of bread out of the bakers’ street, until all the bread in the city were spent. Thus Jeremiah remained in the court of the prison.
